name: Bob, the champion of shadows - F12/CT18/SD10
author: Draconis

posts.author: Pan Draconis
posts.content:
Short backstory :

Bob is a lazy fighter, he doesn't like to be hurt. He's always hiding in shadows to avoid the battle. However, he's really solid, strong and smart, with many combat tactics.

Build explanation :

The build is a balance between offense and defense. This toon has every feat a fighter needs, dev. crit, with the SD defensive skills and feats boosted by CT saves : improved evasion, slippery mind, defensive roll, HiPS usable in full armor. 
His 43 AB is really decent for an hybrid fighter, but he has some situationnal AB with improved disarm and stealth skills and HiPS (flanked or flat-flooded ennemis loose dodge and dex bonuses to AC). 
With uncanny dodge, he can fight in heavy or medium armor (with buffed dex) because he doesn't loose his dex bonus to AC while flat flooded etc.

Against spellcasters, he has high saves, improved evasion and IKD.

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Hey man!

I do like this build. The only thing I might do differently in this case would be to drop Mobility and pick up Exotic Weapons and go with Kukris, dropping some of the feats for 2wf feats. That way, you can have a much higher DevCrit percentage, from 18-20, and at the same time more attacks per round. You really can't fight in Heavy Armor, as the penalty to the skill checks would make you easily detectable by any foes with an average spot or listen total, not to mention the bane of all Shadowdancers: True Sight. Also, if you're not going for Epic Dodge, why so many SD levels? Why not A LOT more Fighter levels for extra feats, or CoT levels for higher saves and some more feats? Uncanny Dodge is attained at SD 2, so you have 8 extra levels there that give you very little benefit, don't you think?

Cheers!
